TopicTitle: [WIP][1.8.x] SSTULabs - Low Part Count Solutions (Orbiters, Landers, Lifters) - Dev Thread [11-18-18]

Articles.Content:
Ah, makes sense it is an artifact of working around the stock code.

Question: could a "service module" be added as a "nose" adapter to the MFT and MUS tanks? Ie: an adapter that has a concave top---like the 1-1-VA adapter on the DOS-TKS?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-09-08T16:14:55Z" title="09/08/2016 04:14  PM" data-short="7 yr">September 8, 2016</time> by tater**

Hi! To start, I want to say: This is my favorite mod! GREAT work guys really!

Have you thought about these crafts: Dreamchaser or X-37b, two really cool real life spaceplanes that would fit your mod in the future right?

Best regards! Keep up the awesome work!

![c96pv9y.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/c96pv9y.jpg)

The answer to my own question is "yes."

**Edited <time datetime="2017-12-19T17:16:17Z" title="12/19/2017 05:16  PM" data-short="6 yr">December 19, 2017</time> by tater**
I tried that, but it didn't give me the ability to decouple the service module. I'll try doing it with a semi-procedural decoupler.

I have shown it in the image above attached to the *lower* node (so you can see it). As a SM, it must be the *upper* node, and it works fine, and looks like a proper SM part ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") .

**Edited <time datetime="2016-09-08T16:59:41Z" title="09/08/2016 04:59  PM" data-short="7 yr">September 8, 2016</time> by tater**

> Ah, makes sense it is an artifact of working around the stock code.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Question: could a "service module" be added as a "nose" adapter to the MFT and MUS tanks? Ie: an adapter that has a concave top---like the 1-1-VA adapter on the DOS-TKS?
> 

As you have found -- yep; simply add it as a 'cap' option (at least on the MFTs... the MUS do not support top cap switching).

However I might need to check on the geometry on that adapter to make sure the concavity is correct/large enough for all of the CM's.
I am home waiting on another repair guy, and I just checked the Apollo and Orion. Looks close enough to me.

I have been playing with SSTU for a long time. This never have been a issue for me.

Just saying.

Edit: [@tater](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/119411-tater/) Oh I see what you are trying to do now. Yeah, that a good idea! When you will have it done can you paste the config?

>

> Just saying.

So have I, I just hadn't really thought about what I was doing WRT making my own SMs much before. Honestly, many times in the past I explicitly added a decoupler under the capsule out of KSP habit. My SSTU craft workflow was only different in that I used the nice SSTU decoupler in every, single instance instead of the awful stock choices ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") . I recently started forcing myself to use the "decouple SM" feature all the time so that it would become "the new normal" for me (to break the stock habit) and realized quickly what I needed to do it after my first test failed. That test failed because it was, as I said, somewhat counterintuitive given the way the tank tops look (and the fact I'm not one who likes to clip parts).

Adding the 1-1-VA cap allows me to do what I have been doing anyway, but with a little more polish.

>

> 
>

My SSTU craft workflow was only different in that I used the nice SSTU decoupler in every, single instance instead of the awful stock choices ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") . That test failed because it was, as I said, somewhat counterintuitive given the way the tank tops look (and the fact I'm not one who likes to clip parts).
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Adding the 1-1-VA cap allows me to do what I have been doing anyway, but with a little more polish.
> 

Hahaha, read above. I got it now. And I want it too!

All I did was add

    	CAP{	name = Adapter-1-1-VA	useForBottom = false}

to the bottom of the list of CAPs for 2 MFT (A and B) tanks in their cfgs as a test. 

**Edited <time datetime="2016-09-08T17:28:59Z" title="09/08/2016 05:28  PM" data-short="7 yr">September 8, 2016</time> by tater**

[@Shadowmage](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/138730-shadowmage/) Can we have a sneak peak of the new toys we will get on next patch? My work is killing me and I need a motivation to survive until the weekend.

> 
> 
> 12 minutes ago, RedParadize said:
> 
> 
> [@Shadowmage](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/138730-shadowmage/) Can we have a sneak peak of the new toys we will get on next patch? My work is killing me and I need a motivation to survive until the weekend.
> 

So far..... not much that I haven't already shown (lots of config work though, and a few bug-fixes).  But... there are three new multi-axis solar panels that I finished up today (upper-right of the image, small, medium, and large):

![Y8p5Ng0.png](http://i.imgur.com/Y8p5Ng0.png)

Folded view:

![m6jVa2C.png](http://i.imgur.com/m6jVa2C.png)

I think that will be it for the rigid/folding solar panels for now.  All use the same mesh/geometry for the mount, so are easily compatible for the panel-switching setup on the DOS parts (or other parts in the future... modular probe core or service module?).  May well make up a few more variants in the future if I find they are needed (and potentially make replacements for the SC-A and SC-C solar panels).  Will also be making an entire lineup of blanket/cloth style solar panels as well, though those are probably a few weeks out from being started.

Other updates for the next upcoming patch will include textures for the COS parts and HUB-COS (shown earlier in the week).  Still working on figuring out the hand-rails situation on those... may or may not be finished for the next release.

So.. basically... the next release is solar panels.  Lots and lots of solar panels.

I love the multi axis panel! And panel switching will be a really nice feature. I shall survive until the weekend.

For the handrails, keep it simple and discrete. They don't have to be like the real one, a approximation will do.

> 

Ok, sweet. I'll experiment with a few tanks and see which fits best. As I badly want this to do rendezvous with my space station. By the way, will solar panels be added to the shuttle like on the cargo bay doors?

EDIT: I think I might need the config. Fuel ducts going through parts doesn't seem to work. XD

> The Shuttle cargo bay doors never had solar panels. Those were *radiators*.

Oh. Interesting. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

To put this in perspective, You need radiator that big just to cool down 6 persons and shuttle instrument.

Damn you thermodynamics!

The first null-ref, regarding the 'consumeResources' points towards an incorrect resource-name being specified in the part (resource is undefined in that game, name is miss-spelled, etc).  This points to a config error that needs to be corrected;  make sure there is a valid resource specified.  RocketParts *should* be valid as long as you have CRP installed (comes with the SSTU download), so I'm not really sure what is going on there.  Maybe try clearing the module-manager cache and re-starting... has cleaned up many a strange error for me before.

The second null-ref, regarding 'updateCrewCapacity' -- is a bug in the code.  Noted and fixed, will be available with this weekends update.  I was running some editor only code (to update the crew roster GUI), but failed to make it actually run in only the editor (was running in flight scene and promptly throwing an exception).

Thanks for the tip and hint.

Glad that for once I did not waste your time. For *once*, I reported a error that was not actually mine!

[@blowfish](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/119688-blowfish/)

Been doing some thinking on the custom shader setup, and I'm pretty sure I've figured out a few new shaders that I could make use of.  Not 100% set on their setup (channels per texture/etc, single UV map or multiple UV maps), but this is what I've come up with so far:

1.) Diffuse (RGB) - Specular (RBG) AO (A) - Bump/NRM   (AO in alpha channel of spec texture; full color specular texture)  

2.) Diffuse (RGB) alpha (A) - Specular (RBG) AO (A) - Bump/NRM    (Alpha in A channel of diffuse, AO in alpha channel of spec texture; full color specular texture)  

3.) Diffuse (RGB) alpha (A) - Emissive (RGB)  (Full-color emissive with alpha support - for 'glow in the dark' decals or whatnot)

Mostly the features that I'm needing are a separate channel for AO (can be a single channel), full-color specular, and some sort of emissive-shader-with-alpha support.

Do you think there would be any desire to have these released as a stand-alone 'shader pack'?  The lineup could easily be expanded to include alternates to the other KSP shaders (non-bump-mapped types, etc)

Screenshot from another day of messing with station parts. Doing approach and docking tests, but the docking went...weird. MechJeb was being stoopid around docking ports/these station parts and didn't want to move the spaceplane any closer than about 30m to the station. 

![ArfAu32.png](http://i.imgur.com/ArfAu32.png)

-

And here's a gif of a later docking test, this time <abbr title="Mechjeb (mod)">MJ</abbr> actually worked.

Thanks, and welcome to the forums ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Spaceplanes -- thanks for the suggestions.  I'm not personally very interested in doing any spaceplane type parts for KSP due to its inability to handle complex/welded part setups for aero.  The shuttle/SC-E was a bit of an experiment to see if it would work out well... and it failed pretty terribly (should have been a single part, ended up being 10....).  Perhaps in the future if stock ever incorporates <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> type functionality I'll take another look at the spaceplanes and aero end of things.

[@Shadowmage](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/138730-shadowmage/) Would it be possible to make a radially attachable, multi-<abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr>-port ring that sort of wraps around fuel tanks when placed, to cut down on parts further? Imagine the modular command probe core but with 4 <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> ports evenly spaced around the outside, but it is placed radially rather than on a node.

Jeez, this is difficult to convey through text.

Here's a sweet MSPaint gif that hopefully gets what i'm thinking about across alightly better

<iframe data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?app=core&module=system&controller=embed&url=https://gfycat.com/CleanDeadCod" style="height:968px;"></iframe>
